# Getting Started with Amazon EC2

This chapter will provide an overview of how to get started setting up an EC2 instance from scratch.  It will explain a number of key topics that may be difficult to understand for newcomers.  This includes: 

* The definition of an "instance"
* Understanding Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) and picking an operating system
* Understanding instance types and characteristics (CPUs, memory, EBS)
* Working with security groups and public/private keys.  This includes how/if to open "ports" and what that means.
